intro: Megastoma, commonly known as the giant bladderwort, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. These plants are characterized by their specialized bladder-like structures used for trapping small aquatic organisms. They are typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Megastoma species are epiphytic, meaning they grow on the surfaces of other plants or substrates. Their botanical significance lies in their unique adaptations for carnivory and their role in aquatic ecosystems.
